Key Match Events: Ireland upset England by five runs in a rainy Twenty20 World Cup Group 1 game
Ireland posted 157 in 19.2 overs with skipper Andy Balbirnie belting 62 from 47 balls and Lorcan Tucker scoring 34
England finished 105 for five from 14.3 overs. Josh Little took 2-16 to lead the Irish attack
Ireland was down to 29-3 in 5.1 overs, losing Buttler for a two-ball duck in a significant blow
Ireland lost nine wickets for 54 runs in less than eight overs
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler said, "We were poor in the first 10 overs and let Ireland get away. We let them score freely on both sides and were not consistent [bowling]". He also mentioned, "We won the toss and bowled first, knowing what we needed to do. We didn't take advantage of it."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The start was delayed by 15 minutes before another 25-minute delay after only 1.3 overs were bowled
Ireland lost its first game in the second round by nine wickets to fellow qualifier Sri Lanka in Hobart
Ireland advanced as the second-place finisher in its preliminary group to join the top eight team and three other qualifiers in the Super 12s
Defeat pushed England down to third in its group with Ireland fourth
Ireland will play Afghanistan next at the MCG on Friday when England will take on defending champions Australia
Others: The game was decided Wednesday on the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method for calculating revised targets
Liam Livingstone took 3-17 in three overs and missed a hat trick
Joshua Little (2-16) then struck again as Alex Hales was out caught for seven runs
Dawid Malan scored 35 off 37 balls to hold the innings together
He put on 38 runs with Harry Brook (18)
Moeen Ali scored 24 not out off 12 balls toward the end, but rain thwarted his plans
